question.questionText: Anna wants to compare the fat in walnuts and peanuts, but she isn't sure how. Write a procedure Anna can use to compare the fat in walnuts and peanuts.

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: Measure out equal masses of walnuts and peanuts. Smash the samples uniformly in the same size area on brown paper. Wait the same time for each sample.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: 1. Get one ounce of walnuts and peanuts. 2. Smear each one on a circle of the same size on absorbent paper. 3. Put it flat on a tray. 4. Wait a couple of days. 5. Measure and take results.
1. Anna can use a brown paper bag. 2. Spread the food on the brown paper bag. 3. Wait 2 days. 4. See which one has the most grease spots.
First weigh the walnuts and peanuts to one gram amount. Then, spread the one gram walnuts and peanuts on the same brown paper. Then wait 2 days.

First you have to have these materials, 2 brown paper indicators, weigh machine, 2 cups, one gram block, spoon and stick. You put 2 cup on each side of the weigh machine with brown paper on each of the cups. Then you smear the food sample on the brown indicator then wait for 2 day.
